page.title: 07Religion Continued.
page.content: throughout the Post Reformation period makes interesting though grim history and today there stands on a rising hill opposite the Manor House a large wooden cross, known as the Matyrs Cross in remembrance and honour of those who had connections with Chideock and who died for their faith. The richly decorated church is Romanesque in design and particularly rich in relics. A Non_Conformist church is to be found on the S.W. side of Hardown Hill.This is used for services and forms part of the original old village of Morcombelake. Abutting onto the church and connected with it there is a village hall which is used for village meetings e.g. Womens Institute and The Hardown Society. A small old graveyard adjoins the church.
